Package br.com.kirgh.app.controllers

Class ApplianceController

java.lang.Object
br.com.kirgh.app.controllers.ApplianceController
@RestController @RequestMapping(path="/api/v1/appliances", produces="application/json") public class ApplianceController extends Object
The ApplianceController class is a Java REST controller that handles requests related to creating new appliances.

  • Method Details

    • applianceRegister

      @PostMapping(consumes="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> applianceRegister(@RequestBody @Valid @Valid ApplianceDTO applianceDTO)
      This is a Java function that creates a new appliance using the data provided in the ApplianceDTO object.
      Parameters:
      applianceDTO - The parameter applianceDTO is of type ApplianceDTO and is annotated with @RequestBody and @Valid. It represents the data transfer object that contains the information needed to create a new appliance. The @RequestBody annotation indicates that the parameter should be populated with the
      Returns:
      The method applianceRegister is returning a ResponseEntity object, which can contain any type of response data along with an HTTP status code. The actual response data being returned depends on the implementation of the createAppliance method in the applianceService class.

    • getFilteredAppliances

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.data.domain.Page<Appliance>> getFilteredAppliances(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable, @RequestParam Map<String,String> filters)
      This Java function retrieves a paginated list of appliances based on filters and returns a JSON response with the appliance information.
      Parameters:
      pageable - The pageable parameter is used for pagination and sorting. It allows you to specify the page number, page size, and sorting criteria for the list of appliances. This parameter is of type Pageable, which is a Spring Data interface that provides convenient methods for pagination and sorting.
      filters - A map of filters for searching appliances. The keys in the map represent the filter criteria, and the values represent the filter values.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a ResponseEntity object containing a Page of Appliance objects.

    • getAllApplianceInfoById

      @GetMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Appliance> getAllApplianceInfoById(@PathVariable UUID id)
      This function retrieves appliance information by its ID and returns a JSON response with the appliance's info.
      Parameters:
      id - The id parameter is a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that represents the unique identifier of the appliance.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a ResponseEntity object with the HTTP status code 200 (OK) and the body containing the Appliance object.

    • updateApplianceInfoById

      @PutMapping(path="/{id}", consumes="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Appliance> updateApplianceInfoById(@PathVariable UUID id, @RequestBody @Valid @Valid ApplianceUpdateDTO applianceUpdateDTO)
      The function updates the information of an appliance and returns a JSON response with the updated appliance's information.
      Parameters:
      id - The id parameter is a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that represents the unique identifier of the appliance to be updated.
      applianceUpdateDTO - The applianceUpdateDTO parameter is of type ApplianceUpdateDTO and is annotated with @RequestBody and @Valid. It represents the updated information for the appliance.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a ResponseEntity object with the updated Appliance information in the body. The HTTP status code is set to 200 (OK).

    • deleteApplianceById

      @DeleteMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> deleteApplianceById(@NonNull @PathVariable @NonNull UUID id)
      The function is a DELETE endpoint for deleting an appliance and returning a JSON response with no content.
      Parameters:
      id - The id parameter is a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that represents the unique identifier of the appliance to be deleted.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a ResponseEntity<String> object.
